definition: to pass judgment on a legal case
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Moreover, Confucian classics were the foundation of the implementation of laws.
sentences.chinese: 在法的实施方面，以儒家典籍为断狱的依据。

sentences.english: An adjudication of shuxiang" was a typical case in ancient history of China."
sentences.chinese: “叔向断狱”是古史记载中的一则典型案例。

definition: xing-ming, a school of thought of the Warring States period associated with Shen Buhai 申不害[Shen1 Bu4 hai4]/the designation for a punishment
Commandant of Justice in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
to hear litigation (in a law court)/to hear a case
a hard legal case to judge
magistrate (during Tang and Song dynasties)/mythological underworld judge
to secure a position/to take an official appointment
